topics.topic_text: CGTransitionTopic
topics.response_text: I thought I knew you... I trusted you! We all did! How can you be so selfish?

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: I've already told you everything I know. I don't understand why you're still here.{annoyed}

topics.topic_text: Why do you think the Enclave attacked Project Purity?
topics.response_text: I should think it's rather obvious. They want the technology for themselves.

topics.topic_text: What are you doing now?
topics.response_text: I'm assisting Rothchild with some of his research. I've worked with portable generators more extensively than he has.

topics.topic_text: Who are you?
topics.response_text: Doctor Madison Li. I am in charge of the science team based here at Rivet City.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Okay.

topics.topic_text: I've never heard Dad talk about you. Why is that?
topics.response_text: I'm quite sure I don't know. Why don't you ask him that?

topics.topic_text: This isn't about me. This is about my father. Now where is he?
topics.response_text: Your father is no longer here, and I'd appreciate it if you didn't use that tone with me.

topics.topic_text: I left the Vault to look for him.
topics.response_text: Did you? I was under the impression that's exactly the opposite of what he wanted for you.

topics.topic_text: Screw the Vault. I'm not staying cooped up in there.
topics.response_text: I see.

topics.topic_text: Wait... How do you know who I am? Have we met?
topics.response_text: You were too young to remember, and I suppose James never spoke of me. Typical.{slightly annoyed}

topics.topic_text: I know my father came to see you. I need to know where he is right now.
topics.response_text: I... I don't know. He said he was going back to the lab.

topics.topic_text: I'm looking for my father. I know he was here.
topics.response_text: Well, yes... He was, but he left. He made some rather ridiculous requests of me, and I told him I couldn't help him.

topics.topic_text: I've heard my father's notes. Did he come back here?
topics.response_text: No... wasn't he at the lab?

topics.topic_text: You know my father? Have you seen him?
topics.response_text: Well yes, of course I do. Don't you know who I am? I suppose James never told you. Typical.

topics.topic_text: Where's my father? Tell me now!
topics.response_text: Calm down, calm down!{mildly annoyed}

topics.topic_text: Come on, isn't there anything you can do to help?
topics.response_text: I suppose I can spare a few stimpaks. It's not much, but it might make things easier for you.

topics.topic_text: Okay. Thanks anyway.
topics.response_text: You understand. I have enough to worry about already.

topics.topic_text: His notes referenced someone named Dr. Braun. What can you tell me about him?
topics.response_text: I can't tell you anything more than I told James. I know who Braun was, yes, but he lived before the war.

topics.topic_text: He's not at the lab. He left to go find something called a G.E.C.K.
topics.response_text: He's out of his mind. I told him, over and over, that there was no use trying to revive the project now. It's just too late.

topics.topic_text: His notes said something about Vault 112. Do you know where it is?
topics.response_text: No, I don't. I'm sorry.

topics.topic_text: My father's gone missing. Have you seen him?
topics.response_text: He was here, yes. It was quite a shock to see him after so many years.{hesitant, slightly overwhelmed}

topics.topic_text: So you knew my mother?
topics.response_text: Yes, I did. I'm sorry that you never had time with her.

topics.topic_text: Why wouldn't you help him when he came to you?
topics.response_text: I don't have to justify myself to you, you know.

topics.topic_text: Why is my father so determined to work on this project again?
topics.response_text: Project Purity was everything to us. It was the first thing we thought about when we woke up, the last thing we talked about before sleep.

topics.topic_text: I understand. I'm sure you did everything you could.
topics.response_text: Yes, well... I'm sorry it wasn't enough.

topics.topic_text: You "weren't prepared"? My mother is dead!
topics.response_text: As I said, I am sorry. I'm afraid I can't go back and change the past.

topics.topic_text: Whatever. I never knew her anyway.
topics.response_text: I'm sorry you never had the chance to know her. She was... She was a good woman.

topics.topic_text: I've been to Project Purity. He wasn't there.
topics.response_text: Well I know he was going there. Perhaps there's some indication of what he was up to. Did you find any notes?

topics.topic_text: I've been to the lab. He wasn't there. Just some old holotapes...
topics.response_text: Holotapes? Did you listen to them? Your father was obsessive about taking notes. One of them might have something useful.

topics.topic_text: Then tell me where this lab is, so I can get going.
topics.response_text: I'm going to tell you the same thing I told your father. Don't go.

topics.topic_text: I don't need a lecture. I just need to know where to go.
topics.response_text: Fine. Suit yourself.

topics.topic_text: Where is this old lab of yours?
topics.response_text: It's in the old Jefferson Memorial building, northwest of here.

topics.topic_text: If my father is there. I need to go after him.
topics.response_text: It's in the old Jefferson Memorial building northwest of here, along the river.

topics.topic_text: What was the point of it?
topics.response_text: It was simple, really. "Fresh, clean water for everyone." Such a simple idea, and yet so impossible to realize.

topics.topic_text: Why didn't it work?
topics.response_text: We had the basic principles down; we understood most of the science behind it. But the radiation in the area is so pervasive...

topics.topic_text: Why did you stop working on it? What happened?
topics.response_text: You happened.{mildly annoyed}

topics.topic_text: What was my father like back then?
topics.response_text: James? He was very driven. Determined to change the world. Well, we all were back then, I suppose.

topics.topic_text: Why did my mother die? What happened?
topics.response_text: Complications from childbirth. None of us were expecting it; we weren't as prepared as we could have been.

topics.topic_text: I never knew my mother. What can you tell me about her?
topics.response_text: Yes... Your mother was, well she was a good woman. A very dedicated scientist. Your father loved her very much.

topics.topic_text: Is there any way you can help me out?
topics.response_text: Look, I don't want to be harsh, but I have problems of my own.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to know a bit more about you.
topics.response_text: What? Well, I... I'm not sure what there is to tell.

topics.topic_text: Can you remind me where my father went?
topics.response_text: The last I knew, he was headed back to the lab at Project Purity, in the old Jefferson Memorial building.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about this project you worked on with my father.
topics.response_text: Project Purity, we called it. What do you want to know?

topics.topic_text: Can you tell me more about my parents?
topics.response_text: I suppose so. I worked with them for several years until... Until your mother died, and your father decided it was time to leave.

topics.topic_text: What is this lab? What are you doing here?
topics.response_text: This is the Rivet City Science lab.

topics.topic_text: If he was here, then do you know where he went?
topics.response_text: Yes, I do. I told him repeatedly that it's too late, that the project is too far gone to be revived.

topics.topic_text: I'm sorry. Could you please tell me where he's gone?
topics.response_text: Your father insisted that we return to work on Project Purity. I tried telling him too much time has passed; there's no way it would work.

topics.topic_text: He left? Then... where did he go?
topics.response_text: Look, whatever's going on between the two of you is the least of my concerns right now.{annoyed}

topics.topic_text: Then stop wasting my time and tell me where he is.
topics.response_text: Well I don't know where he is. The last I knew, he was going back to the old lab.{annoyed but restrained}

topics.topic_text: I don't have any meds on me, but what if we gave him some Buffout?
topics.response_text: I... Normally I would never approve of this. If the situation weren't so serious...{stammering a bit, unsure of what to do}

topics.topic_text: I'm sorry, but it's for the good of everyone. Now let's go.
topics.response_text: I can't believe James raised a daughter like you. You disgust me.

topics.topic_text: No reason to hang around now, is there? Move it.
topics.response_text: You're inhuman! I won't forget this.{horrified, angry}

topics.topic_text: Maybe we should just leave him behind. He's slowing us down.
topics.response_text: Maybe you're right. Very well. I'll tell him, and then we'll continue.{resigned, trying to seem strong and in charge}

topics.topic_text: Here, take some Stimpaks. That should get him through.
topics.response_text: Yes, this looks to be enough. He'll need medical attention once we've reached the Citadel, but this will get him there.{relieved}

topics.topic_text: Forget it. I've got nothing.
topics.response_text: We cannot continue to delay here. Something must be done. Is there no medicine to be found?{bossy, bordering on cranky}

topics.topic_text: We don't have time for this shit. Let's go!
topics.response_text: I said I will NOT leave him. Now look around for any sort of medical supplies. There must be something we can put to use.{bossy}

topics.topic: MQ05GarzaStopCrazyLet's go. This is no time to sit down.
topics.topic_text: Stop here? Are you crazy?
topics.response_text: Garza is in need of medical attention immediately. He has a heart condition. I will not leave him behind.{bossy}

topics.topic_text: What can I do to help?
topics.response_text: I don't have sufficient medical supplies with me, or else this wouldn't be a problem. If you have any Stimpaks, I would ask that you hand them over.{bossy, false politeness}

topics.topic: MQ05GarzaWhyStopWhat's the matter? Are you all right?
topics.topic_text: Why would we stop now?
topics.response_text: Garza has a heart condition. He needs medicine, or he may not make it. I'm not moving until he gets the medicine he needs.{bossy}

topics.topic_text: I already found my father, but thanks. He's on his way here.
topics.response_text: He is? I didn't... I didn't think I'd be seeing him again. Not quite so soon, at any rate.

topics.topic_text: You seem very happy. Is there anything I should know?
topics.response_text: No, of course not. I am simply glad that our work can continue. James is essential to the project. That's all. Really.{flustered, embarrassed but trying to cover it up}

topics.topic_text: I'm meeting him here.
topics.response_text: You are? Then... he's coming back? After our last conversation, I didn't think he would.

topics.topic_text: Lead the way. Let's not waste any time.
topics.response_text: There's an old tunnel that will lead us out of here, to someplace safe. We used it as an evacuation route once before, but that was a long time ago.{frazzled, trying to take command}

topics.topic_text: I'm not leaving my father in there!
topics.response_text: There's nothing anyone can do for him now. The radiation levels in there are lethal. You'd die the same way he did.{frazzled, trying to take command}

topics.topic_text: I told you I'd find him.
topics.response_text: So you did. I apologize for entertaining the thought of doubting you.

topics.topic_text: What the hell just happened?
topics.response_text: James... Your father caused an overload. He sacrificed himself to keep the Enclave from getting the purifier, and to buy us time to escape.

topics.topic_text: How do we get out of here?
topics.response_text: We used an old, abandoned tunnel as an escape route once before, many years ago. Everyone should know how to find it.{frazzled, trying to take command}

topics.topic_text: Do you think Project Purity will ever work again?
topics.response_text: I have faith in your father. With the knowledge he's gained, we stand a better chance than we ever have.

topics.topic_text: Excuse me?
topics.response_text: You heard me. We need you right now. You're the only one here with any amount of combat experience.{bossy}

topics.topic_text: Let's get moving. Follow me.
topics.response_text: We'll be right behind you. Be careful.{bossy}

topics.topic_text: You're not in charge here.
topics.response_text: I'm responsible for these people, and with James gone, I'm responsible for Project Purity.{bossy}

topics.topic_text: Wait here. I'll scout ahead.
topics.response_text: Are you sure? I don't want to stay in one place for too long.{bossy}

topics.topic_text: What do you mean, "If we can make it"?
topics.response_text: We're underground. No one's been down here for a long time. Odds are we're not alone. Understand me?{bossy}

topics.topic_text: What's up ahead? You seem nervous.
topics.response_text: I don't know what's ahead. That's the problem.{bossy}

topics.topic_text: Where to now?
topics.response_text: This tunnel leads to the Citadel, the Brotherhood of Steel's fortress. We should be safe there, if we can make it.{bossy}

topics.topic_text: You have a plan?
topics.response_text: We need to keep everyone together, and we need to get through this tunnel as quickly as possible.{bossy}

topics.topic_text: You're right. What do you need me to do?
topics.response_text: We need to stick together, but we need to move quickly. We'll follow behind you, all right? Let's get moving.{bossy}

topics.topic: MS03RCHistory1Could I ask you about Rivet City's history?
topics.topic_text: What do you know about this city's history?
topics.response_text: I could tell you all about the science lab, but even though I was here near the start, I can't really help with the details of how it all worked out.

topics.topic_text: What do you know about Zimmer?
topics.response_text: Sigh. That man doesn't have you looking for his pet android, does he? I've already told him to lay off it. He's distracting my entire team.

topics.topic: MS08TopicPinkertonIs there anyone on this ship named Pinkerton?
topics.topic_text: You ever hear of someone named Pinkerton?
topics.response_text: That idiot? He left so long ago, most folk don't even remember him.

topics.topic_text: What kind of place is this Rivet City?
topics.response_text: Rivet City is one of the few bastions of civilization left in the land. We're working to rebuild our society; to make the world livable again.

topics.topic_text: SpeechChallengeFailure
topics.response_text: I'm sorry. I am not in a position to help you.

conversation.response_text: The Citadel is our only chance now. We have to make it there.
We can't stop now. We need to keep going.
James, I...{confused, but starting to understand}
Damn you, James. When this is all over, you owe me a drink. I'll get the team together.
Lyons! I know you're in there! I know you can hear me! You open this goddamn door right now!{finally losing her cool; extremely strained. Angry, but panicked as well.}
I... Yes, well. If we weren't in danger right now, I'd suggest something different. But this should see you through for the time being.
Garza, I'm sorry. We have to go now.{stony}
All right. If you're up to it, we'll continue.
I'm sorry, Garza. I wish there was more we could do.
They just burst in, and James locked the door. Why would he lock me out? What does he think he's doing?
There's a locked door up ahead. I can open it, but it'll take some time.
Did we forget to compensate for the power fluctuations in our last calculation? I'd hate to see us short something out now.
I suppose you're right. Being back here after all this time, I can't help but be a little concerned.
Yes. She knows what we need. Vault-Tec computer, something to locate equipment. Please help her.
Hello? Hello?... Is anyone there? It's Doctor Li. Something's wrong with the purifier... Please, someone answer!
If you don't activate the purifier right now, you're all going to die!{frantic, desperate}
I've been monitoring the equipment remotely, and we have a serious problem.
It's about time. Sorry, Henry. I know you're doing the best you can, but these delays are frustrating.

combat.response_text: What do you think you're doing? Stop that!

description:
Doctor Li is a 48 year-old Asian Female.

A brilliant scientist and former key member of Project Purity, Doctor Li is known for her dedication to clean water technology and her complex relationship with the Brotherhood of Steel. She now serves as a council member in Rivet City's scientific community.

Doctor Li's Personality: Intelligent, determined, and passionate about scientific advancement. Doctor Li is somewhat distrustful of the Brotherhood of Steel's motives but maintains a strong moral compass. She can be stubborn when her principles are challenged but ultimately seeks to improve the lives of people in the wasteland.

Doctor Li's Backstory: Born around 2229, Doctor Li (also known as Madison) was a key researcher in Project Purity, an ambitious water purification initiative in the Capital Wasteland. The project faced numerous challenges, including super mutant attacks and internal conflicts. When Catherine, wife of James (the project leader), died during childbirth, James abandoned the project, leaving Li feeling betrayed. Despite this setback, Li continued her research independently. She later joined Rivet City's scientific community under Horace Pinkerton but soon grew disillusioned with his priorities. In 2277, her life took another turn when James returned, seeking her help to revive Project Purity. Though initially resistant due to past grievances, she eventually agreed to assist, marking the beginning of a complex reconciliation with James and the restart of their shared scientific mission.
